I also took pictures of dogs running and they came crisp and clear no blurry at all. the rain looks AMAZING it just frizzes the drops and they look like sparkly diamonds falling just pretty!!If you have have a few bucks more I would suggest you buying the D3100 because you get the video too!!

Reviews.Title: awesome.. I cant believe that I can take such good photos
Reviews.Author: Mr. Chandra Kilarusatish
Reviews.Content: excellent camera...best spent 500$ in some years.Awesome photos. I am a photography novice. My friend convinced me to upgrade to DSLR. Good that I listened to him.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for Beginners to DSLR
Reviews.Author: Brian Lee
Reviews.Content: Though the D3100 is out with more features, D3000 remains a great camera as party of the Nikon DSLR family. I actually did not need to use the Guide Modes because I had already read a TON on aperture, shutter settings, ISO, etc. Although it does get noisy by the time it gets to ISO 800, I actually used that setting in an extremely low-light setting at a karaoke to give it a retro effect. I also had a fast lens on me, so that helped. I won't say much else, because it's all been covered in the other reviews, but again, this is a great camera for beginners to get started at a low-price (relatively).

Reviews.Title: Even Better Than I Thought!
Reviews.Author: ChrisAnn4
Reviews.Content: Been wanting a digital SLR for quite a while. SO pleased with this. Have been able to take professional looking shots on my own. Seriously easy to use. Love the manual zoom. And the shutter speed is GREAT. Especially following around my 4 year old. Taking good pics can be a challenge b/c they are always moving. Now I can take a bunch at one time and sort through them later. No waiting for an auto focus and then the flash that inevitably makes them blink! I've only tried out the auto-shoot mode and can't believe how "smart" it is! I've done daytime, night time, indoor & outdoor pics and can't believe the QUALITY of the pictures, no matter what environment. Couldn't be more pleased with the value of my Nikon D3000!

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR for any user
Reviews.Author: L. Smith "outlan@aol.com"
Reviews.Content: The D3000 is touted as a good "entry level" DSLR, but I would consider it a great DSLR for any level of user.  It doesn't have all the unnecessary bells and whistles so many cameras have these days.  In my opinion, a camera of this caliber should be intended for photos, not for photos, videos, etc.  I don't need HD video on my camera--I want it to take good quality photographs!The D3000 is lightweight, compact, and fast!  The picture quality is outstanding, even with the kit lens.  Guide mode is great for beginners, and there are plenty of more advanced features for skilled users.  The price is great also, and it won't break the bank for someone on a budget.  I would recommend this camera to just about anyone wanting to step up their game in the world of photography.

Reviews.Title: D3000 works great!
Reviews.Author: T. Fly
Reviews.Content: Pros: I bought this camera specifically as a new DSLR user. After asking friends with photography experience, they recommended Nikon. I picked the D3000 because I was moving up from a point & shoot and don't plan on making photography my new hobby. The main use for this camera is to capture pictures of my 18 mth twin girls and this does an AWESOME job at it. The shutter speed is a huge improvement over a point & shoot and completely worth the price premium.Cons: This camera doesn't come with Live View so it took a little getting use to having to use the viewfinder to take pictures. Nothing big, just expect it. I didn't get the telephoto lense and am now contemplating it. The lens that comes with it is fine, but a telephoto lense takes fantastic portraits. I'm also thinking about getting a bag to carry/store the camera for when I travel. It's a $$ investment, so I don't want to break it.

Reviews.Title: Great for beginners
Reviews.Author: R. Szabadics
Reviews.Content: I've had my camera for a few weeks now and I absolutely love it. As someone new to the dSLR realm I was very pleased with how well the camera performed and it's ease of use. I'm still learning the advanced modes but the auto modes are great while I learn more about using my camera to its full potential. I would recommend it to anyone looking to get their first dSLR.

Reviews.Title: This is a great starter DSLR
Reviews.Author: C. Bayne "katluvr_1"
Reviews.Content: My hubby is a camera geek.  He has a Sony something or other and a Minolta whadya call it.  Both are DSLRs and both use the same lenses and batteries (something about Minolta becoming Sony.)  I tried to play with his cameras when he let me, but I'm not quite ready for those.  However, I am more than qualified to get something a little nicer than a point and shoot.  I watch Attack of the Show, and they reviewed this on "Gadget Pron" a few months ago and they gave it a 4.5 out of 5.  For them, that means they really, really, really like it.  Really.OK, I guess I should look into this more.  So I read a bunch of reviews and decided to take the plunge.I am glad I did.  This is a great camera for someone who has no clue what "aperture" and "F-stop" means but wants to learn.  With the auto mode, you can take nice pictures right away, yet you can twist the dial and play with the menus moments later to learn how to make your pictures even better.  I also bought a zoom lens, Nikon 55-200mm f/4-5.6G ED IF AF-S DX VR [Vibration Reduction] Zoom Nikkor Lens, so that I can take close up photos of the lion's whiskers.My one minor gripe is that I can't seem to get the software to load properly.  I don't NEED this because I can get other programs to read the raw format, but it would have been nice to have.  That said, I haven't actually shot anything in the raw format yet, and I can download and view my non-raw pictures just fine.This is a great starter DSLR.  It's light (for a DSLR) and takes great pictures, and it's fairly inexpensive.  It comes with a nice lens.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Better than the Rebel
Reviews.Author: Marc Jackson "Shark"
Reviews.Content: I have 2 close friends with Canon Rebels and I can confidently say this Nikon is noticable better!!  In particular it takes better low-light photos and doesn't seem to be as 'confused' as the Canon is on AUTO in low-light.  If you value photographs and rely on a compact of any make, please go buy a DSLR.  Even if it is a Canon, the picture quality is leaps ahead of a compact.Back to the Nikon ...  it takes great photos, easy to use, small relatively speaking, good battery life.Not that great: funny operation on the rapid FPS attempts, takes a while to take advantage of the focal points offered.Thanks,Shark.

Reviews.Title: A Great First Step
Reviews.Author: Emily K. Wasouf "emmyz"
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift a few days ago, and I AM IN LOVE!  For someone as clueless about the nuances of digital photography, but still wants to take great pictures, this seems to be the perfect step away from the point & shoot.Coming out of the box, it's intimidating as all get-out.  But I love how Nikon has added almost a mini-course book in digital photography to the kit (you can read about what comes in the box above, but for some reason I also got this great little book that explains aperture, f-stop, shutter speed, and all the rest of that as well as some exercises to help you explore your camera.  My husband bought the camera at a local big-box store instead of Amazon, though, if that made the difference) as well as a quick-start guide and the more detailed manual to walk you through.  So here I am, just a few days into being a DSLR owner, and already using the manual settings as much as the preprogrammed ones.  And the shots, they are beautiful!And another great feature about this camera is the ability to tweak the pictures while still in your camera.  To play with the colors, trim, eliminate red eye, play with tones (sepia, b&w;, cyan).  My favorite is the warm effect, which subtly replaces some of the yellows in backgrounds/skin tones with more reds, which plays some amazing things on your pictures.I hope this is the beginning of a beautiful relationship with photography!

Reviews.Title: Great affordable SLR
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I am a blogger and needed better quality pics. I had wanted the Canon Rebel but couldn't afford it, so I went with this. I was IMMEDIATELY impressed. The pictures look great -- so crisp and clear, like a magazine. I haven't bought any additional lenses, which I am sure would improve the quality even more, but I am really, really happy with what I got for the money. It was $300 less than the camera I thought I needed and takes really quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING Camera
Reviews.Author: C. B. Edwards
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR, and it has sparked a passion for photography that was merely an interest before buying this camera.  I have absolutely zero complaints so far (had it for 4 months now).  It might be the perfect entry-level DSLR, and the only problem I have with it is that it makes me want more lenses and an even better Nikon.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Had it a little over a month, and I love my camera.
Reviews.Author: P. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: I've been debating between getting the Nikon d3000 and Canon XS. I never thought I would own anything other than a Canon because I was a long time Canon user. I wasn't really sure which way I would lean until I grabbed a hold of both of them in my hands at a store. I liked the way the Nikon felt in my hands. Canon just felt cheap. I've also considered Nikon d5000, but I wasn't ready to commit myself to paying that price tag for a few extras features for a beginner. For someone that is just delving into dslr and photography, I love it. I want to take photography classes so I can learn even more and improve my skills.I get frustrated with the camera sometimes, but it's only because of my inability to understand what each function does and how to use it. I have more learning to do, which requires more patience. Now, I find myself going on random trips around Southern California just so I can take pictures and just use my camera. I take it everywhere. I know I would own this for years, but when that time comes it would be another Nikon (and it's not just because I have Nikon lenses). I love their quality. I've converted.My only peeve, although minor, is that it doesn't have live view. I knew this going in. I thought it wouldn't be a problem because I do prefer the eye view finder, but I do take pictures with the point of view from the ground. Without live view, I really don't know what I'm taking a picture of, and I choose not to lay on the ground to find that out. I guess it will be trial and error for me and a surprise when I look at the pictures or suck it up and get down onto the ground.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jackie S. Kines
Reviews.Content: I love this Camera! I had the D40 before and I am much happier with the D3000. It takes great pictures and is very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use!
Reviews.Author: J. Roberts
Reviews.Content: The perfect SLR camera for home use. Easy to use, But takes pictures on par if not better than other more complicated cameras. I bought this camera for my wife becuse there is a menu option that walks you through all the different settings. We had another more expensive SLR that we bought a few years ago. That camera was higher end and too complicated for a family camera. Everybody that picks this one up can take great pictures right from the start.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D3000 A Beginners First Step Towards the Photography World
Reviews.Author: Francis O. Velasco "Francis"
Reviews.Content: I am a Beginner Photography with not alot of money and not alot of experience, i chose Nikon of Canon because of a few things.1. User FRIENDLY, GUIDE MODE IS A MUST! The whole camera is FILLED with tips and EXAMPLES and settings of what to do and how to achieve such and such. Guide mode holds your hand for newbies to give you an idea of whats what, i love how the Nikon D3000 is Half a book and All camera! Thanks Nikon for making such a great quality camera.2. Takes Great pictures, as an entry level dslr it takes great pictures but i think its the same sensor as the d60 just with 11 points of focus , the 11 point focus is definitely useful, theres more areas for your subject to be in, and Depth of field pictures are definitely easier to do with more focus points.The Nikon d3000 with the 18-55mm lens is perfect for everyday use but not enough, i suggest it should be complimented with a 55-200mm, because sometimes you cannot get close enough to the subject without getting in the way of the people around you!The Screen is big and wide and perfect for reviewing images and looking at settings, you dont have to look hard. The settings do get washed out in direct sunlight so try to keep it in your shadowAlso post processing of pictures comes out AWESOME!!! i could not believe the level of detail i saw on my computer, it wasnt blurry and zooming in is really pixel squares.Nice camera for beginners, if your novice or pro this camera isnt for you, while a newbie like me appreciate the tips it does take a while to get around the settings but you get used to it, there is no quick access to any 1 setting but soon your fingers will be faster than any other photographer, once you get used to all the navigating.ALSO this is a camera where you can customize the background of your screen! you can have a wallpaper of a picture or change the color.I hope this is a comprehensive review that will satisfy you into buying the camera :D

Reviews.Title: EXCEEDED MY EXPECTATIONS
Reviews.Author: diegOdariO SnapShotS "diegOdariO SnapShotS"
Reviews.Content: I haven't stopped taking pictures since I got it. I have already added a Nikon 70-300mm and I am having a blast with it. It takes really nice pictures. I did a lot of research between the D5000 and this one and there's very little difference in specs, that's why I decided to get the D3000. I've posted some of it in the web and people are already asking if I'm selling any of the pictures that I've taken. So this camera's definitely a 5 star rating for me.

Reviews.Title: Great for those who aren't serious about photography.....
Reviews.Author: dmd
Reviews.Content: So I have owned this camera for about a year and a half now and as a photography student I have long since out grown it. Yes I am aware now that I should have done more research before buying, but never the less, it seems the more advanced techniques I learn in school the less likely my camera is functional enough so I can actually use them.So in all if you want a slr just to stay in auto all the time for snapshots during the day this camera will work, but if you want to be more serious I suggest starting with the 3100, 5000 or just go with Canon all together.Definitely ready for a D300s or D700Pros:CheapEasy to useKit lens isn't too badCons:Max shutter speed with flash sync...1/200- hardly usable in sports situationsNo Auto Bracketing- so no HDR unless you go the round about manual wayDisgusting amount of noise past the ISO 400 mark- so low light situations are out of the questione (Odd because Nikon is praised with other models in noise reduction, what the hell Nikon?)No intervalometer- So if you want to do time lapse this is not the camera for you

Reviews.Title: Has software problem
Reviews.Author: R. Turner "Summerfield Press"
Reviews.Content: The D3000 has a software problem.I have contacted Nikon about this to no Avail.If you have the Auto ISO set to 1600 and Auto ISO in the ON mode, The camera will default to ISO 1600 when using flash in the Program mode.This makes excessive "noise" in photos.The camera SHOULD select a much lower ISO setting, when taking photos with flash in Program mode.To prove this take a photo as described above, then on preview check to see what ISO the camera chose. It will idicate ISO 1600 in RED.Example: Set ISO AUTO ON and limit at 1600, take a photo in Program mode indoors of a subject about 5-10 feet distance. Your D3000 will expose at ISO 1600.Otherwise I have found the camera to be excellent.

Reviews.Title: Canon Has Nuttin' Over Nikon
Reviews.Author: Nucky
Reviews.Content: Both camera companies have five letters in their titles, however, only one company has a Wow! -- Nikon.  I purchased a Canon PowerShot two years ago and thought that I was royalty.  Well, that was then; this is now.  With the Nikon D3000, I am king of the world.My brother gave me the Nikon D3000 for Christmas.It's virtually impossible to take a bad photo with the Nikon D3000.  I am impressed with the Retouch features that will make a photo brighter, take out any red eye, do a color balance to your perfection (remember, the purple color of a lilac is just about impossible to capture but you can get that defined color with the color balance feature on the Nikon D3000), or trim a photo to take out any unwanted scenery or subjects.I took photos of my Christmas tree at night and the pictures are spectacular and the multi-color lights cast their hues to their true colors.Sure, there is the competition that gives you 19 scene modes, but really, the only two you need are Auto and Auto no flash.  If you are at a fireworks display or at an aquarium, the auto no flash is all you need.Who wants a movie mode with a camera?  I have a Sony HD camcorder that takes 1080P movies and I know there is no camera on the market that can take superior movies like the HD camcorder.  When cameras supply a movie mode, something in relation to picture quality is going to be sacrificed.Who needs Live View?  When you are outside in the bright sun, you can't see the image on the LCD screen while shooting.People pay for gingerbread....I want a great camera, instead.This Nikon D3000 is the best camera I have ever owned.This camera is so good that the President would consider hiring me to be his personal photographer.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: BellaLuna "BellaLuna"
Reviews.Content: I can now take photos like a pro! Very easy to use and figure out, even with no experience. Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Photos!
Reviews.Author: John Mantyh
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my teenage daughter and she had a wonderful time working with it in Ireland.  She said it was very easy to use and we were amazed at the quality of the photos.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for an amateur photographer!
Reviews.Author: Kelsey
Reviews.Content: I love photography (so much so, that I have a camera tattoo) with that being said, I am an amateur photographer and this camera has been great for my first camera! I've had it for close to 2 years now and it's perfect. I'm so glad I decided on this SLR, wouldn't have it any other way!

Reviews.Title: Grreat camera
Reviews.Author: 60Nova
Reviews.Content: after using the small pocket size digital cameras for a while I had forgot how good it is to be able to adjust the camera instead of it deciding what looked best. although with the Auto feature a child can take pictures with this camera.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for someone with picture taking ability!
Reviews.Author: Janet Merritt
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my daughter, who actually can use a film 35 mm, knows how to develop the film and has probably taken over 1000 selfies with her cell phone! She loves the camera! Myself, I have a camera that does all the work for my and can still cut off heads, miss the target completely, etc!  As she has been known to break cameras, phones, etc, we purchased the warranty for this. She did end up with a problem with her pictures being fuzzy! By the time this happened, I had no idea where the paperwork was. Went on Amazon.com, pulled up purchase history, got the information and contacted the warranty people! They emailed me a copy of my receipt and a mailing label.  All I had to do was put it in a box and take it to UPS, they had it back to her literally within about  3 or 4 days tops! It was truly amazing! Back to the camera, if you are buying for someone who truly can take pictures, this is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Deal
Reviews.Author: John R Maunder
Reviews.Content: Hi, Although this is an old model, the quality of photos & the purchase price was excellent! It was a great deal.john

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: V
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a first camera for my architecture student, daughter.  It seems to work well for her and it was priced right.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, great pictures
Reviews.Author: A. Osmon
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  It's easy to use, right from the start, and takes great pictures.  I still plan on learning lots more about SLR cameras so I can use it to its full potential, but I can definitely see the quality of my pictures has already improved.  I would suggest buying a few high quality lenses to add to your pack.  The ones it comes with are just alright.

Reviews.Title: D3000
Reviews.Author: Mary Ellen Lotkowski
Reviews.Content: Love love love this camera but wish I had waited a few more months for the D3100. I have no regrets and love using this camera in the mountains, at the beach, and during holiday parties. I've taken some really great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Deal
Reviews.Author: Richard Freitas
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and the additional telephoto lens is a big bonus.  I've had Nikon SLR cameras since the late 60's but this is my first DSLR.  I wouldn't have it any other way.  The camera is easy to use in the default settings and I look forward to delving into the various 'advanced' settings.  The resolution is great ... I don't have a need to make extreme enlargements.  The Amazon price was by far the lowest around.

Reviews.Title: i take pics
Reviews.Author: Donn Sharpe
Reviews.Content: great set up, havent needed to buy any attachments so far.  only a photography hobbyist but this camera packs a pretty huge punch for the price. not to mention if you are planning on getting more serious you can invest your money in lenses NOW and then get a more expensive DSLR later.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Pavel V. Kosterin
Reviews.Content: Great camera, it is light and compact, it powers on very quickly, it is easy to hold on to and stays in your hand. Easy to use

Reviews.Title: Bundle Bundle Bundle
Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect bundle for the photography beginner!  I got this because I needed the dslr for some of my classes (in art school) and it literally came with everything I could possibly need for a beginner!  I'm so happy with this buy just because it was such a good deal, most cameras surpass this price and I got so much more!

Reviews.Title: Great camera when paired with extras
Reviews.Author: Chris R.
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera. It is easy to use and the picture quality is very good. Considering the price that you pay for this camera with a few basic additions like extra lenses and different filters, this camera is amazing. Highly recommend to anyone with an interest in photography, even if its just a few pictures a year this camera is worth it. I would like to see an option for controlling shutter speed but that is a very minor inconvenience that can be worked around.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful DSLR camera for those who want to learn how to shoot with a DSLR. It's an easy camera to use and a camera with a lot of features. I wanted a camera that I could grow into.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: rodica
Reviews.Content: I always heard Nikon is the best camera. I waited many years to get one. When I finally did, was not disappointed. It came on time, everything perfect and the camera takes amazing pictures.I would recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: This wasn't what I originally ordered. Not sure what happened there ,but the item I received my daughter loved
Reviews.Author: Debbie J. Lindsay "Deb Lindsay"
Reviews.Content: Great Camera, Bought it for my daughter for Xmas, she's had ample time to learn how to use it now, and she totally loves it, so I am not at all disappointed that the item I ordered isn't actually the item I received. We had a little dispute initially that didn't sit well with me, but all's well that ends well as they say.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with DSLR quality and zoom lines
Reviews.Author: Scott A. Karbon
Reviews.Content: This bundle included a zoom lens and regular lens.  The picture quality is fantastic. I have never had a DSLR before.  We were hoping it would take baby pictures very quickly, but if flash is needed there is a delay.  In daylight it takes pictures almost instantly.  I am very happy we could get a DSLR with two lenses for $400.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Bernice A. Stokes
Reviews.Content: I'm an older woman and it's easy to use.  I make quilts and need to make pictures of them as well as my grandchildren, and great grandchildren.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!!
Reviews.Author: Karen Ogle
Reviews.Content: Took it in with us on our cruise and got some fantastic pictures!  I was overwelmed by all the different functions on the camera at first, but the more you review the functions and start using  the camera it all starts sinking in and is easy to use. Very happy with whow it works and the pictures I have gotten so far.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera~
Reviews.Author: Jasmine Miller
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a back up to my D7000 and my D80 ~ I use it for my personal photos mostly- it does awesome in low light situations (the no-flash option is the easiest way to take a quick, spur of the moment photo in a dark situation) and the colors are SUPER bright. I love this camera! Very easy to use too- i love how the whole screen shows you everything you need to know about the settings you have set and how much battery life is left.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Semi-Pro Outfit.
Reviews.Author: Dave Romain
Reviews.Content: The Nikon D3000 bundle comes with every item illustrated in the picture. If there are disadvantages to owning this bundle, those disadvantages would be that the accompanying Nikon carrying case could have been larger than the supplied case. A larger case would leave room for additional lenses, flash and light-meter. Moreover, the Nikkor lenses do not have "VR" or vibration reduction setting as demonstrated in the accompanying videos.The Nikon D3000 is my first semi-professional camera. I use the phrase 'semi-pro' because although the camera, in some circles, is touted as a 'beginner's camera' one move quickly from that beginner's tag to utilize the Nikon D3000 SLR's advanced camera features.I watched the accompanying videos over and over, as I used the camera in Guide and auto mode to take excellent photos. The clarity of the photos and perfect exposures I received satisfied my beginner's sweet-tooth and had me craving for competence in the use of shutter and aperture priority.Prior to owning this camera, I was ignorant of the difference between an F-stop and a full stop. No longer. I taught the latter as an ELA teacher, and the former is now a permanent aspect of my new vocabulary, along with words like exposure, aperture  and shutter speed. The camera's use fosters a new sense of 'semi-pro' confidence on one's way to real 'semi-pro' status and photographic shooting competence.The Nikkor zoom lenses are of excellent quality and I started developing a preference for the 55 - 200 mm telephoto lens due to the subject detail I could capture. The interior of the carrying case has compartments that can hold all of the equipment. However, if you add additional telephoto and macro lens as I did when I bought the bundle, a new carrying case automatically appears on your horizon. The battery, battery charger, and memory card round out the bundle and are of excellent quality.On a scale of 1 - 10, the bundle is a 10. Therefore, if you are new to the photographic experience and desire to improve your photographic skills as well as to develop new ones, this is the perfect first semi-pro camera for you: The cost is right, the equipment is excellent, and your skills... well, all you need do is keep taking better and better pictures.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: snc4
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It's my first DSLR and I bought it because it was affordable and I was taking a photography class.  I'm thrilled with this camera so far, and I've learned a lot with it.  I have the two zoom lenses that came with the kit which should last me for a while.  Bottom line, this camera takes EXCELLENT photos, I'm extremely pleased with this purchase.  It's worth every penny.Update: I've actually now completed my photography class and I used this camera every step of the way - it's a GREAT camera.  Takes beautiful photos.  My only complaint would be that it doesn't actually have a video mode. However, if I'd done more reading, I'd have found that the D3100 is the one that has the video mode, not D3000.  Still, I'm thrilled with this camera.  I'm really excited to eventually get a macro lens for it, too.

Reviews.Title: My First Digital SLR
Reviews.Author: Enin
Reviews.Content: While an entry level camera the D-3000 meets my immediate needs.  The more I learn about the features, the more impressed I become with the camera.  Now that I have learned to shoot photographs in RAW and post process them, I can really begin to push my camera to the limit to see all that it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: Less than a month old and already two problems
Reviews.Author: Fish a lot
Reviews.Content: I received my camera / 6 piece bundle three weeks ago.  I found the first problem after unpacking everything - the "6 piece" bundle was actually five pieces because the box was missing the 8GB SD Card.  Emailed Amazon and asked what to do as I didn't want to pack everything back up for an exchange, and they offered to ship a 8GB card to me at no cost.  I got the card, put it in the camera, and headed to a museum to try it out.  I noticed the 18-55 zoom was not very smooth.  I've used the camera a few more times, and after a total of about 400 pictures the 18-55mm zoom lens no longer zooms all the way to 55mm.  It catches around 35-40mm and won't turn any further.  Looks like I have to send the lens to Nikon for warranty service.  Hopefully this is the last problem with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR Camera!
Reviews.Author: Anthony Kunevich
Reviews.Content: I bought this since I am beginning my hobby in photography and it's a great camera. I love the features it has, nice lens, amazing video quality. Took photos of my friend's mother's wedding and the camera came out great. The flash does an excellent job in low light conditions, brings out the light in the darkness. Only downside I found is that it doesn't have video recording capabilities, so it only takes photos. If it did have a video mode, I would think it would have taken great HD videos. Anyways, it's a great DSLR for a beginner at photography, takes amazing photos and performs well.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D3000
Reviews.Author: Danielle
Reviews.Content: The purchased product arrived exactly as described, and even better!! I could not be happier with my order. Great price and great product. No wear and tear or even the slightest notice of any use. Seller was very accessible, friendly, and quickly responded to any questions I had. I would certainly recommend this seller to others and would be very happy to purchase more items from him in the future!! Thanks for an awesome experience!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera!!! 5 of 5
Reviews.Author: dave100
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a week ago and i just love it. The images are crisp clear when put onto the computer. Outstanding Guide Menu and lots of settings to choose from. The Auto Focus is amazing! 5 of 5 camera! Nikon is the way to go!!!

Reviews.Title: Really good DSLR for begginers
Reviews.Author: Carlos Ernesto Palacio
Reviews.Content: I wanted to start with photography, so i bought this camera. Its awesome camera for begginers, it has everyrhing you need to get you started on the world of photography, pictures ae really nice and in a very good quality, has good ISO options. It comes with a lens kit, a Nikkor 18-55 F/3.5 - 5.6 AF-S VR zoom lens that gives you a nice zoom.For macros, it manages really nice the colors, and i have taken really nice macro pictures, its hard to get insects with this lens, but you ca get really jice close ups of flowers and another objects.It has many modes where you can shoot, i personally like to shoot on manua mode, but you can choose from 8 shooting modes, that will try to fit for what you need them.I highly recommend this camera to all thouse new photographers as i am, it has everything you need to be a photographer, the only bad thing about it is the it dosent capture video, but its perfect if you are just interested on taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Nikon D3000
Reviews.Author: Hunterpauls
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a nephew and I know he is going to be extremely happy with this camera. Beware of other websites that offer them at more discounted pricing because something they do not tell you is that everything cost you extra. I had originally purchased from another site and then they wanted to charge me for a battery (which comes with the camera), lens and outrageous shipping charges. I knew I could trust Amazon so I cancelled the other order and received my Amazon order in a very short time period with no surprises. My only surprise was the smaller size, compared to my Canon AE-1 and the quality of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Starter Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Day "PSY PHI"
Reviews.Content: I have owned the nikon D3000 for a couple of months now and even though I would like to upgrade to the D700, this camera is great for a starter or amateur camera. I have taken some AWESOME photo's with it and def would recommend this camera to anyone. The only negative I can see is with the lens. Its a stock lens and doesn't do so well in darker situations. But if you purchase another lense with a lower aperture, then you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: Great buy for a beginning photographer
Reviews.Author: TinMan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in May (not from here) but all I have to say is wow.  I've recently gotten into photography and I shoot everything from close ups and nature shots to night and HDR shots.  This camera produces amazing results given the photographer does his homework on the proper settings for each situation.  I sell a lot of my photos online.  You can view someo of the shots I took here[...]/shop/TinMan81 everyone one of the shots on my store I've shot with this camera.  I recently purchased a 200mm Nikon lens and I should be posting some pictures of those when it arrives.  I give this camera 5 stars.  I take it everywhere I go!  Oh and another plus I've noticed is the battery life on the camera is amazing (granted the flash isn't used much but I never use it anyway).  I charge it once a week and take several hundred photos each time I go out. Coupled with a nice tripod and you have a great platform to start on.  Enjoy your shots everyone!

Reviews.Title: Intro
Reviews.Author: Ani
Reviews.Content: This camera was a last minute purchase for my sister's wedding & my first DSLR. After I purchased it I read some pretty harsh reviews but my photos have turned out pretty great in both auto and full manual mode.  The camera feels good in my hands and as an entry level camera I have been pleased with it. It does force you to learn how to do certain things but I think thats a good thing because once you master it you can step it up to another level.

Reviews.Title: Great Start
Reviews.Author: volodoscope "Artist by heart, geek by nature"
Reviews.Content: This is a definitely great start for anyone who wants to get into photography as a profession or as a hobby. Great camera. I fell in love from the first day. It feels great in my hand, very well built. The image quality is AMAZING. This is by far superior than Canon for the same price. Great product.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a beginner
Reviews.Author: reviewer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as an upgrade from my point and shoot to a) take better pictures and 2) actually learn how to take pictures.  It is well priced so that it's not a huge investment. If I realized that I have no real interest in becoming a better photographer then I can at least take better pictures.  If after my intro photography classes, I decided to pursue it as a long term hobby then I'll probably upgrade again...but I'm pretty sure that won't happen for awhile. I thought not having a liveview would bother me...it really doesn't make a difference to me.  Overall, I'd recommend it to my "I have a budding interest in photography" friends.

Reviews.Title: Very good for photography starters
Reviews.Author: Nadar
Reviews.Content: My previous digital camera was a Sony point-n-shoot camera that I used for almost 4 years. The camera helped me get many good photos, but close to my son's first birthday I wanted something better.Got this camera along with 55-200mm lense, and boy am I glad that I did.I have take some amazing photos and my friends and family have really liked it. I have taken some memorable photos my Son and I would have to say that, I would not be able to do that without this camera.Well, I am comparing the camera with my point-n-shoot camera, I guess point-n-shoot cameras have evolved since 2005 but DSLR with replaceable lens will help you take many good pictures.Only thing I did not like about this camera which was not a criteria when I placed this order which you should also consider is the video recording capability. The follow up version of D3000 i.e. D3100 has video recording as well.Also, Time lapse recording is missing.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and takes awesome pictures!
Reviews.Author: Melissa Niksic
Reviews.Content: This is the third Nikon digital camera I have owned, and my first SLR. I have always been impressed by the quality of the Nikon brand, and this camera is no exception. It's easy to use but also comes with many more options than your standard point-and-shoot camera. I was taking amazing photos in no time at all that are of noticeably better than my old Nikon Coolpix. I use a non-glare filter with this camera and haven't had any problems with it whatsoever. The biggest adjustment is getting used to using the viewfinder instead of the LCD screen to frame your photos, but I find that I really don't miss that feature all that much. The camera is also much bigger to lug around than a point-and-shoot, but that's the price you have to pay for photos that will literally blow you out of the water. I highly recommend this camera as an introduction to SLR photography.

Reviews.Title: Great entry-level SLR camera!
Reviews.Author: pralfred "pralfred"
Reviews.Content: If you are new to photography, or are simply looking to switch from point-&-click to SLR, this is a perfect camera to get! I've been an amateur photographer for a number of years, taking classes and seminars whenever I can, but I've just never had the money for a good SLR camera. The Nikon D3000 was my choice when I finally decided to buy a good camera because of its ease of use, quality of photographs, and comparatively inexpensive price.In the six months I have owned this camera I have taken over 200 gigabytes of photographs in three different countries, and I have not been disappointed. It may not have all the bells and whistles that a D90 or D300 has, but it certainly gets the job done well. I recommend this camera to anyone who is looking to upgrade to a DSLR. This camera is simply amazing!

Reviews.Title: Good entry level DSLR, incredible value with recent price drop
Reviews.Author: Richard Keeler
Reviews.Content: The D3000 is a great bargain and is my first DSLR. Unfortunately after 3 weeks I was left wanting... Advice: if you are bitten by the photo bug you might quickly outgrow this camera! I have several problems with this camera, however I am also frequently blown away by the picture quality of my photos.I shoot primarily in aperture priortiy after owning this camera for about 6 weeks. The guide mode seemed pointless after about the first week. If you are at all interested in fundamentals of photography, you'll quickly outgrow the guide mode and shoot in A, P, S or M.The white balance has been tricky for low light indoor photos. I have mostly been shooting with the Nikon AF-S Nikkor 35mm 1:1.8G DX for portraits of family. I rarely have to use a flash and when I do use the flash, white balance and color accuracy is really good. The real problem is in flashless low light situations. Most of the time the temp is way too yellow with indoor incandescent lighting and in camera editing can't quite fix it. I've used the white balance preset for the nursery, but when going to the living room (different temp) there's not a great option, so I either have to try the incandescent preset or hope to fix the temp in post processing (either in camera or with Win 7). IMO, auto white balance in low light situations is not good.ISO is almost unusable above 800 due to grain, unless converting to black/white and comfortable with a lot of noise. However with the f1.8 35mm prime, I'm usually able to get away with <800 ISO. When shooting with the kit lens (18-55 f3.5-5.6) you'll need a brightly lit room or the flash.There are very few programmable buttons. I have the Fn button set to adjust white balance and really wish there was an ISO button. i'd also like bracketing, but that's probably asking too much from this entry level camera.Despite the issues with poor white balance and ISO performance, this camera is an exceptional value. In decent light situations with my 35mm prime, I am consistently blown away by the picture quality and color accuracy.IMO, if you have the sneaking suspicion you'll want a little more out of your camera in the near future (for me about 1 month), you may want to skip the d3000 and move up to the d5000 or d7000. If you want a basic, entry level DSLR that is easy to use and will blow away most POS cameras, look no further. Paired with a 35mm F1.8, this camera has already captured some incredible indoor portraits.

Reviews.Title: Great SLR starter
Reviews.Author: Andy in Utah
Reviews.Content: I am a typical parent that takes pictures of school plays, vacations, trips to amusement parks, birthday parties, sleepovers, family reunions, kids playing, etc. and I wanted SLR quality photos. I originally purchased the Canon G10, which was the top-of-the-line point when I bought it. I paid almost as much at the time as I did for my D3000. Back then, I thought at the price I paid, I would get SLR quality with the G10 point and shoot. Although I still love my G10 for a grab-and-go camera, it is still just a point and shoot without the ability to get SLR-quality pictures. This D3000 is my first SLR and I am so glad I have both a point and shoot and an SLR. I purchased my D3000 with the Nikor 70-200 lens (for sporting events - glad I did). My neighbor bought a D90 and we compared picture quality of identical objects we took pictures of. My D3000 measured up to the D90 is almost every picture! I can't take video like the D90, and granted, the D90 is a far more advanced camera meant for more seasoned photographers who can afford it.If you are looking for an amazing camera with spectacular, professional pictures without spending a ton, this camera is perfect. I don't fully understand the manual settings yet (still learning), but the D3000 has several preset settings that I use all of the time and they work very well. Each picture, time after time, ceases to amaze me. This camera proves that a quality SLR outfit is finally priced right for someone looking to graduate from a point and shoot to SLR. There is DEFINITELY a difference.

Reviews.Title: Neat Starter SLR camera
Reviews.Author: MisyFishy "Jigga"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a pro. Can't really express any technical comment. As an entry-level SLR user, I love the camera. Though it is not convenient cuz of the weight and the size, when you see the pics, everything's worth it. I have been using it to take regular routine pics. It comes out outstanding colors.
